intro: Spermacoce neglecta, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is an erect, herbaceous annual that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the morning. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, shiny seeds. Spermacoce neglecta is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
